text:
Note that questions on the future value of an annuity due refer to the amount in the
account one period after the last deposit is made. If the three deposits considered here
were made at the beginning of each period (at t = 0, 1, 2) the amount in the account at
the end of three years (t = 3) would be 10% higher (i.e., 641 x 1.1 = $705.10).
